metadata.feature_description: Manages assets across multiple portals with portal-specific root folders and permissions

steps.action: Navigate to Assets panel and click on 'My Website' portal
steps.expected: Should display assets specific to My Website portal
steps.actual: Successfully displayed My Website's assets including folders (Badges, Groups, Images, PermissionsTestFolder, Templates, Users, WorkflowTestFolder) and files

steps.action: Navigate to Assets panel and click on 'Global Assets'
steps.expected: Should display host-level system assets with globe icons
steps.actual: Successfully displayed Global Assets with globe icons on folders (Cache, Config, Containers, EventQueue, Install, Logs, Skins, Smileys, Templates, Users) and system files

steps.action: Navigate back to portal selection and switch from Global Assets to Test Portal
steps.expected: Should seamlessly switch to different portal's assets
steps.actual: Successfully switched to Test Portal and displayed its assets (Badges, Images, Templates, Users, cavalier-logo.png, GettingStarted.css)

steps.action: Navigate into Images folder of Test Portal
steps.expected: Should show Test Portal's specific images
steps.actual: Test Portal Images folder contained cavalier-tv.png, CTA-1.jpg through CTA-8.jpg, product images - no subfolders

steps.action: Navigate to My Website and access its Images folder
steps.expected: Should show different content than Test Portal, proving isolation
steps.actual: My Website Images folder contained 3 subfolders (Publisher, SecureFolderTest2026 with lock icon, TestNewFolder2026) plus different files - confirming portal isolation

steps.action: View portal selection showing all three root folders
steps.expected: Should display three distinct portal root folders with appropriate icons
steps.actual: Successfully displayed three portal root folders: Global Assets (globe icon), My Website (folder icon), Test Portal (folder icon)

steps.action: As SuperUser, verify full management access across portals
steps.expected: SuperUser should have full access (Add Folder, Add Asset) on all portals
steps.actual: SuperUser has Add Folder and Add Asset buttons visible, can access all folders including PermissionsTestFolder, and can navigate freely between portals

observations: Global Assets folders have distinct globe icons to differentiate from portal-specific folders
SecureFolderTest2026 in My Website shows a lock icon indicating secure folder type with different permissions
Code review confirmed IsPortalIdValid() method enforces portal access: SuperUsers can access all portals, Admins can access portal groups, regular users limited to their portal
GetPortalsRootFolder() method returns host folder for SuperUsers plus all portal folders, enabling multi-portal management
Each portal maintains completely isolated folder structures with no cross-contamination of assets
